subject: RE: [junit] Re: assertEquals
msgSnippet: What type of data are you comparing? Is it possible that the comparison ligic in the equals method is wrong, returning false when it should be returning
messageBody:
What type of data are you comparing? Is it possible that the comparison
ligic in the "equals" method is wrong, returning "false" when it should be
returning "true"? Just grasping at straws... :-)

Peter

Peter Spitz
Team Leader/Senior Software Developer
InSystems Technologies
19 Allstate Parkway, Suite 400
Markham, Ontario
L3R 5A4 Canada

> -----Original Message-----
> From: benjamin@...
> [mailto:benjamin@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, October 23, 2001 9:54 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: assertEquals
>
>
> The message is absolutly right.
> copying again from an other run:
>
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Wrong country
> expected:<com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0> but
> was:<com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0>
>
> I don't think it is coming from JUnit though. If I do the following:
>
> System.out.println(aCountry.isIdentical(aJurisdiction.getCountry()));
>
> I got a "false".
> The following:
> System.out.println(aCountry+ " "+aJurisdiction.getCountry());
>
> I got:
> ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0
> ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0
>
> I wonder if JBoss is not to blame. I'll send them a mail
>
> --- In junit@y..., Jason Rogers <jacaetev@y...> wrote:
> > This seems highly unlikely. Two objects pointing to the same
> reference are
> > absolutely equal. Are you sure you copied the message properly?
> >
> > -jason
> >
> > --- benjamin@h... wrote:
> > > Hello,
> > > I am testing a EJB with an assertEquals and I get the following:
> > >
> > > junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Wrong country
> > >
> expected:<ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.Countr
> > > yPK@e0> but
> > >
> was:<ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e
> > > 0>
> > >
> > > which puzzles me, because it looks like they are equal. But I am
> new
> > > to JUnit and I might not get it.
> > >
> > > Thank you,
> > > Benjamin
